thread.title: Orioles postpone Friday night's Yankees game
thread.title_full: Orioles postpone Friday night's Yankees game

title: Orioles postpone Friday night's Yankees game
text:
Orioles postpone Friday night's Yankees game UPDATED 4:07 PM EDT Oct 02, 2015 
The Orioles-Yankees game Friday night has been postponed due to rain. Related NWS: Tornado touched down Tuesday in... 
The game will be made up as part of a split-admission doubleheader on Saturday at 12:05 p.m. and 7:05 p.m. Separate admission is required for each game. 
Tickets for Friday’s game marked Oct. 2 will be honored for the 12:05 p.m. game on Saturday. Gates for the 12:05 p.m. game will open at 10:30 a.m. Parking lots will open at 10 a.m. 
Gate times for the 7:05 p.m. game will be announced at the conclusion of the first game. 
Friday night's fireworks show has been canceled and will be not be rescheduled. 
Fans unable to attend the makeup game can exchange their tickets for any remaining home game this season on a “dollar-for-dollar” basis. StubHub tickets are also non-exchangeable, but may be resold on StubHub until noon Saturday. Prepaid parking permits dated for Oct. 2 are valid only for the 12:05 p.m. makeup game on Saturday. Fans may also choose to hold their tickets until 2016 tickets go on sale, at which point they may be exchanged for tickets to any April 2016 home game, except Opening Day. All exchanges are subject to availability and must be completed by April 30, 2016.
